intro: Eugenia finisterrae, commonly known as the Sierra de San Francisco guava, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
